description: From Latin geranium, from Ancient Greek γερᾰ́νῐον (geránion), from γέρᾰνος (géranos, “crane”) + -ῐον (-ion, diminutive suffix).

adjectives.description: geranium (comparative more geranium, superlative most geranium)

entries.meaning: Of a bright red color tinted with orange, like that of a scarlet geranium.
Any flowering plant of the genus Geranium, the cranesbills, of family Geraniaceae.
The common name for flowering plants of the genus Pelargonium.
A bright red color tinted with orange, like that of a scarlet geranium.
